page.title: 08RIVER BAILIFF
page.content: Mr. Tom Richardson is the River Bailiff on the River Wye in Monsal Dale. He has been employed by the Chatsworth Estate for eleven years. His 'beat' consists of the stretch of the River from Cressbrook Mill to just above Ashford in the Water. His job is to patrol the river to check on the birds the plant life and the fish stock. Fishing is strictly limited to people with permits and Mr. Richardson spends time checking permits, meeting the fishermen and offering advice. Each day he write up detailed notes on the days fishing. He also keeps in touch with local farmers and works in conjunction with the other river bailiffs and the Peak District Ranger Service.
